title: Prima Porta
description: Prima Porta, located to the north of Rome, allegedly derives its modern name from the remains of a Roman aqueduct whose presence signaled to travelers on the Via Flaminia that they had reached Rome. The site is best known for an Imperial villa that belonged to the family of Livia Drusilla.

properties.description: 1:150,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 21046
